attributes.name: CacheManager
attributes.description:
The CacheManager wraps a Cache enforcing that only
the public API surface area is exposed.

Hence, it is the value of `Store.cache`, wrapping
the cache instance returned by `Store.createCache`.

It handles translating between cache versions when
necessary, for instance when a Store is configured
to use both a v1 and a v2 cache depending on some
heuristic.

Starting with the v2 spec, the cache is designed such
that it must be implemented as a singleton.

methods.description:
Cache the response to a request

Unlike `store.push` which has UPSERT
semantics, `put` has `replace` semantics similar to
the `http` method `PUT`

the individually cacheable
e resource data it may contain
should upsert, but the document data surrounding it should
fully replace any existing information

Note that in order to support inserting arbitrary data
to the cache that did not originate from a request `put`
should expect to sometimes encounter a document with only
a `content` member and therefor must not assume the existence
of `request` and `response` on the document.
methods.name: put

methods.description:
Perform an operation on the cache to update the remote state.

Note: currently the only valid operation is a MergeOperation
which occurs when a collision of identifiers is detected.
methods.name: patch

methods.description:
Update resource data with a local mutation. Currently supports operations
on relationships only.
methods.name: mutate

methods.description:
Peek resource data from the Cache.

In development, if the return value
is JSON the return value
will be deep-cloned and deep-frozen
to prevent mutation thereby enforcing cache
Immutability.

This form of peek is useful for implementations
that want to feed raw-data from cache to the UI
or which want to interact with a blob of data
directly from the presentation cache.

An implementation might want to do this because
de-referencing records which read from their own
blob is generally safer because the record does
not require retaining connections to the Store
and Cache to present data on a per-field basis.

This generally takes the place of `getAttr` as
an API and may even take the place of `getRelationship`
depending on implementation specifics, though this
latter usage is less recommended due to the advantages
of the Graph handling necessary entanglements and
notifications for relational data.
methods.name: peek

methods.description:
Peek the Cache for the existing request data associated with
a cacheable request
methods.name: peekRequest

methods.description: Push resource data from a remote source into the cache for this identifier
methods.name: upsert

return.description: if `hasRecord` is true then calculated key changes should be returned

methods.description:
Create a fork of the cache from the current state.

Applications should typically not call this method themselves,
preferring instead to fork at the Store level, which will
utilize this method to fork the cache.
methods.name: fork

methods.description:
Merge a fork back into a parent Cache.

Applications should typically not call this method themselves,
preferring instead to merge at the Store level, which will
utilize this method to merge the caches.
methods.name: merge

methods.description:
Generate the list of changes applied to all
record in the store.

Each individual resource or document that has
been mutated should be described as an individual
`Change` entry in the returned array.

A `Change` is described by an object containing up to
three properties: (1) the `identifier` of the entity that
changed; (2) the `op` code of that change being one of
`upsert` or `remove`, and if the op is `upsert` a `patch`
containing the data to merge into the cache for the given
entity.

This `patch` is opaque to the Store but should be understood
by the Cache and may expect to be utilized by an Adapter
when generating data during a `save` operation.

It is generally recommended that the `patch` contain only
the updated state, ignoring fields that are unchanged

```ts
interface Change {
 identifier: StableRecordIdentifier | StableDocumentIdentifier;
 op: 'upsert' | 'remove';
 patch?: unknown;
}
```
methods.name: diff

methods.description:
Serialize the entire contents of the Cache into a Stream
which may be fed back into a new instance of the same Cache
via `cache.hydrate`.
methods.name: dump

methods.description:
hydrate a Cache from a Stream with content previously serialized
from another instance of the same Cache, resolving when hydration
is complete.

This method should expect to be called both in the context of restoring
the Cache during application rehydration after SSR **AND** at unknown
times during the lifetime of an already booted application when it is
desired to bulk-load additional information into the cache. This latter
behavior supports optimizing pre/fetching of data for route transitions
via data-only SSR modes.
methods.name: hydrate

methods.description:
[LIFECYCLE] Signal to the cache that a new record has been instantiated on the client

It returns properties from options that should be set on the record during the create
process. This return value behavior is deprecated.
methods.name: clientDidCreate

methods.description:
[LIFECYCLE] Signals to the cache that a resource
will be part of a save transaction.
methods.name: willCommit

methods.description:
[LIFECYCLE] Signals to the cache that a resource
was successfully updated as part of a save transaction.
methods.name: didCommit

methods.description:
[LIFECYCLE] Signals to the cache that a resource
was update via a save transaction failed.
methods.name: commitWasRejected

methods.description:
[LIFECYCLE] Signals to the cache that all data for a resource
should be cleared.
methods.name: unloadRecord

methods.description: Retrieve the data for an attribute from the cache
methods.name: getAttr

methods.description: Mutate the data for an attribute in the cache
methods.name: setAttr

methods.description: Query the cache for the changed attributes of a resource.
methods.name: changedAttrs

methods.description: Query the cache for whether any mutated attributes exist
methods.name: hasChangedAttrs

methods.description: Tell the cache to discard any uncommitted mutations to attributes
methods.name: rollbackAttrs

return.description: the names of attributes that were restored

methods.name: changedRelationships

methods.description: Query the cache for whether any mutated attributes exist
methods.name: hasChangedRelationships

methods.description:
Tell the cache to discard any uncommitted mutations to relationships.

This will also discard the change on any appropriate inverses.

This method is a candidate to become a mutation
methods.name: rollbackRelationships

return.description: the names of relationships that were restored

methods.description: Query the cache for the current state of a relationship property
methods.name: getRelationship

methods.description:
Update the cache state for the given resource to be marked as locally deleted,
or remove such a mark.
methods.name: setIsDeleted

methods.description: Query the cache for any validation errors applicable to the given resource.
methods.name: getErrors

methods.description: Query the cache for whether a given resource has any available data
methods.name: isEmpty

methods.description:
Query the cache for whether a given resource was created locally and not
yet persisted.
methods.name: isNew

methods.description:
Query the cache for whether a given resource is marked as deleted (but not
necessarily persisted yet).
methods.name: isDeleted

methods.description:
Query the cache for whether a given resource has been deleted and that deletion
has also been persisted.
methods.name: isDeletionCommitted
